text: today's recipe is really delicious it's
a cookie using fresh mint have never put
fresh mint into a cookie I never have
until this berry recipe I'm really
excited to share it with you it's a
fresh mint and crystallized ginger drop
um
I'm picking some fresh mint you need
three tablespoons it's about 20 large
leaves you know I was just thinking how
I'm constantly saying to you guys this
is my favorite herb particularly when it
comes to basil or cilantro or parsley
and then I realized they're all my
favorite I love fresh herbs which is why
I'm doing an entire week of fresh herb
recipes once you have your 20 large
leaves or 150 small leaves like I do
finely chop your leaves once again with
fresh herbs it's always important for
them to be clean but very dry otherwise
they'll just mush and be disgusting then
you need two tablespoons of finely diced
candied ginger you can find that with
the other dried fruits or with the
candied fruits in your baking aisle just
cut them into long narrow strips and
then turn them and cut them crosswise
into the dice it's a little bit hard to
chop so don't be concerned just transfer
your ginger to the bowl you're gonna
whisk your dry ingredients in and add
the mint also and then to that a
tablespoon of finely grated lemon zests
make sure your lemon is well washed or
organic and then add a cup of
all-purpose flour
and then also a quarter teaspoon of
baking soda whisk everything together
make sure that the ginger gets evenly
distributed here - so if it's clumped at
all just go in with your fingers and
pull it apart no big deal okay here I
have one stick of room temperature
unsalted butter a quarter cup of light
brown sugar and a quarter cup of regular
sugar I'm just gonna cream those
together with my
and mixer you want to make sure that it
gets all evenly combined and light and
fluffy
making sure you get all the little bits
on the side then add one large egg yolk
you only need the egg yolks that
separates your egg and a half a teaspoon
of vanilla extract make sure it's the
pure stuff and measure away from the
bowl beat to combine and then add your
dry ingredients
I can totally smell the mint and the
lemon now super fragrant in here now
it's time to form the cookies I have
parchment lined baking sheets here and
some coarse sanding sugar scoop the
dough by rounded teaspoons and then roll
into balls and roll in the in the core
sanding sugar done have your oven
preheating to 350 degrees and then bake
the cookies rotating once for 14 minutes
if you can stand to wait to let them
cool I highly suggest it because you'll
end up with a crisp delicious little
morsel of cookie hmm dunk it in a little
bit of pee or eat it with your coffee
and then be supersite their crisp
they're a little bit sweet they're
lemony they're minty they're fantastic
you
